byline.contributor: Serge F. Kovaleski and Lorne Manly contributed reporting.
byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and SYDNEY EMBER

abstract: Previously undisclosed deposition given by Bill Cosby in 2005 features testimony that portrays comedian as unapologetic, cavalier playboy who regularly pursued young women for sex; testimony was delivered over four days as Cosby defended himself from lawsuit brought by young woman who said he drugged and molested her; Cosby admitted that he used his fame, manipulation and powerful sedatives to obtain sex, though he portrayed acts as consensual.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Cosby testified over four days of intense questioning 10 years ago at a Philadelphia hotel, where he defended himself in a deposition for a lawsuit filed by a young woman who accused him of drugging and molesting her.

headline.main: Bill Cosby, in Deposition, Said Drugs and Fame Helped Him Seduce Women
headline.print_headline: Cosby Detailed Many Affairs in Testimony
